skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, artifacts, posters, or applications (examples include websites, landing pages, dashboards, React components, HTML/CSS layouts, or when styling/beautifying any web UI). Generates creative, polished code and UI design that avoids generic AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill wh...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and guidance for frontend design. No executable code, scripts, or security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Transform your web interfaces into distinctive, production-grade experiences that stand out from generic AI-generated designs with bold aesthetics and meticulous attention to detail.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-ready HTML/CSS/JavaScript code with distinctive aesthetics
Create React, Vue, and other framework-based components with unique design directions
Design landing pages, dashboards, and web applications with bold visual identities
Implement sophisticated animations and micro-interactions using CSS and motion libraries
Apply creative typography, color schemes, and spatial compositions
Build accessible, performant interfaces with attention to design details
Avoid generic AI aesthetics through intentional, context-specific design choices
limitations: Requires clear understanding of project context and constraints to make effective design decisions
Design quality depends on providing adequate context about purpose, audience, and technical requirements
Cannot guarantee specific framework compatibility without explicit requirements
Visual distinctiveness may require iterations to align with specific brand guidelines

use_cases.title: Distinctive Landing Pages
use_cases.description: Create memorable landing pages that break away from cookie-cutter templates with bold typography, unexpected layouts, and cohesive aesthetic direction
use_cases.target_user: Startups, product launches, and marketing teams needing standout web presence

use_cases.title: Production Dashboard Interfaces
use_cases.description: Build functional, beautiful dashboards with sophisticated data visualization, refined spacing, and intentional design choices that enhance usability
use_cases.target_user: Product teams, SaaS companies, and internal tools developers

use_cases.title: Custom React Components
use_cases.description: Design and implement React components with unique visual identity, smooth animations, and production-grade code quality
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers building component libraries or design systems

use_cases.title: Creative Web Artifacts
use_cases.description: Generate artistic web experiences, interactive posters, and experimental interfaces with maximalist or refined minimalist aesthetics
use_cases.target_user: Digital artists, creative agencies, and portfolio sites

prompt_templates.title: Landing Page with Aesthetic Direction
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for [product/service] targeting [audience]. Use a [brutalist/retro-futuristic/organic/luxury] aesthetic with [specific color preference if any]. The page should emphasize [key message] and include [sections: hero, features, CTA, etc.]
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a landing page that immediately communicates brand personality

prompt_templates.title: Dashboard Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [React/Vue/vanilla JS] dashboard for [use case] that displays [data types]. Design should be [minimal and refined/bold and data-dense]. Include [specific features: charts, tables, filters, etc.]
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating data-heavy interfaces that need both function and form

prompt_templates.title: Styled Component Library
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a set of UI components (buttons, cards, forms, navigation) for [project type] with a [aesthetic direction] theme. Target framework: [React/Vue/Web Components]. Emphasize [specific design goals]
prompt_templates.scenario: When building reusable components with consistent design language

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Web Experience
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an interactive [portfolio/presentation/exhibit] page featuring [content]. Use dramatic animations, [specific visual effects], and a [maximalist/editorial/artistic] approach. Make it unforgettable
prompt_templates.scenario: When pushing creative boundaries for artistic or experimental projects

output_examples.input: Create a landing page for an AI coding assistant with a brutalist aesthetic
output_examples.output: Production-ready HTML/CSS/JS with raw, bold typography (distinctive display fonts), high-contrast black/white color scheme, asymmetric grid-breaking layout, exposed borders, monospace accents, and deliberate spacing that creates visual tension

output_examples.input: Build a React dashboard for sales analytics with a refined minimal design
output_examples.output: React component code with sophisticated typography pairing, generous negative space, subtle animations on data updates, muted elegant color palette with CSS variables, clean grid system, and micro-interactions that enhance usability without distraction

best_practices: Always establish clear aesthetic direction before coding (purpose, tone, constraints, differentiation)
Choose distinctive typography - avoid generic fonts like Inter, Roboto, Arial
Use CSS variables for consistent theming across components
Implement animations strategically for high-impact moments rather than scattered micro-interactions
Match implementation complexity to aesthetic vision (elaborate code for maximalism, precise restraint for minimalism)
Consider accessibility alongside aesthetics (contrast, motion preferences, semantic HTML)
Test across different viewports and ensure responsive design
Vary design choices between projects - avoid converging on common patterns
Use backgrounds and visual details to create depth and atmosphere
Commit fully to chosen aesthetic rather than hedging with timid compromises
anti_patterns: Using generic font families (Inter, Roboto, Arial, system fonts) without intentional reason
Defaulting to cliched purple gradients on white backgrounds
Creating cookie-cutter layouts that lack context-specific character
Applying the same design patterns (like Space Grotesk font) across different projects
Using solid color backgrounds when atmospheric effects would enhance the design
Scattering animations randomly instead of orchestrating cohesive motion design
Choosing timid, evenly-distributed color palettes instead of dominant colors with sharp accents
Implementing elaborate code for minimal designs or sparse code for maximalist visions
Ignoring the project's purpose, audience, and context in design decisions

faq.question: What makes this different from other frontend design approaches?
faq.answer: This skill emphasizes intentional, bold aesthetic decisions and context-specific design that avoids generic AI-generated patterns. It focuses on creating memorable, distinctive interfaces through unexpected typography, creative layouts, and cohesive visual direction.

faq.question: Should I always use maximalist designs?
faq.answer: No - both maximalist and minimalist approaches work when executed with precision and intentionality. The key is committing fully to a clear aesthetic direction that matches your project's purpose, not defaulting to generic middle-ground solutions.

faq.question: What frameworks does this work with?
faq.answer: This skill can generate code for vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other frontend frameworks. Specify your technical requirements in the prompt for framework-specific implementations.

faq.question: How do I ensure accessibility with bold designs?
faq.answer: The skill considers accessibility alongside aesthetics - maintaining proper contrast ratios, using semantic HTML, respecting motion preferences, and ensuring keyboard navigation. Bold design and accessibility are complementary, not contradictory.

faq.question: What if I don't know what aesthetic direction to choose?
faq.answer: Provide context about your project's purpose, audience, and goals. The skill will propose an appropriate aesthetic direction based on these factors, but you can also request specific styles (brutalist, retro-futuristic, editorial, etc.) or ask for options.
